channel.title: BBC Sport | Other Sports | Disability Sport | UK Edition
channel.description: The latest BBC Disability Sport news plus comment, analysis, calendar, A-Z of paralympic classification, audio and video.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/help/rss/4517815.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Sinclair gets GB Paralympic call
item.description: Martin Sinclair, brother of Swansea's Scott Sinclair, and veteran Dave Clarke both named in GB Paralympic football squads.

item.title: Brothers make ParalympicsGB squad
item.description: ParalympicsGB name three sets of brothers in their boccia, judo and powerlifting squads for the 2012 Games

item.title: Roberts misses ParalympicsGB team
item.description: Dave Roberts, an 11-time gold medallist, is left out of the Great Britain team for the 2012 Paralympic Games.

item.title: GB draw on Petitclerc experience
item.description: The Great Britain Paralympic athletics team hope the influence of one of the world's most successful Paralympians can help them star at London 2012.

item.title: Defending champions miss standard
item.description: Defending Paralympic champions Dave Roberts and Liz Johnson must wait on the British Swimming selectors to see if they have made it on to the team for London 2012.

item.title: Swimmers backed to shine at Games
item.description: British Swimming Paralympic director John Atkinson believes his squad will shine at the London Games after Sheffield trials.

item.title: Roberts misses qualification time
item.description: Eleven-time Paralympic gold medallist Dave Roberts fails to hit the qualifying time in the 50m free at the Paralympic trials in Sheffield.

item.title: Swimmers target 2012 Games spots
item.description: GB Paralympic swimming hopefuls have their last chance to qualify for London 2012 at this weekend's trials in Sheffield.

item.title: Simmonds opposes Paralympic merger
item.description: Double Paralympic champion Eleanor Simmonds says she would not support any plan to combine the Olympic and Paralympic Games.

item.title: GB Paralympians fill all London 2012 places
item.description: Great Britain has a place in every paralympic sport at London 2012 as the goalball and sitting volleyball teams make the grade.

item.title: Simmonds breaks 200m world record
item.description: Ellie Simmonds becomes the first person to break a world record at London's Aquatics Centre in the 200m individual medley.

item.title: Pepper ready to realise Paralympic dream
item.description: Dan Pepper faces crunch time at the GB swimming trials as an athlete with a learning disability.

item.title: Paralympic torch heralds landmark
item.description: The Paralympic torch design has a mirrored finish so its colour adapts to its surroundings and also shines.

item.title: GB para-cyclists top medals table
item.description: Britain's para-cyclists put in a strong performance at the World Championships in Los Angeles but the competition is improving.

item.title: GB grab more Para-Cycling golds
item.description: Great Britain win six more medals - including four golds - on day three of the Para-Cycling Track World Championships in Los Angeles.
